riddle: What do you call a sad coffee?
What could ruin and fix your life at the same time?
What question can you honestly never answer “yes”to?
My spine is stiff, my body is pale, I’m always ready to tell a tale. What am I?
I am full of holes yet I have no problem holding water. What am I?
I am not alive, but I grow. I don’t have lungs, but I need air. I don’t have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
If eleven plus two equals one, what does nine plus five equal?
answer: On a clock, 11:00 plus 2 hours = 1:00, 9:00 plus 5 hours = 2:00

riddle: I met a man on the London bridge, he tipped his hat and drew his cane, in this riddle I told you his name. What is it?
I am seven letter word. I am very heavy. Take away two letters from me and you will get 8. Take away one letter and you will get 80. Who am I?
A man went around the world in a ship. Yet he was always in sight of land. How is that possible?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest person can’t hold me for five minutes. What am I?
In 1990, a person is 15 years old. In 1995, that same person is 10 years old. How can this be?
The eight of us go forth not back to protect our king from a foes attack.  What are we?
What is a skeleton’s favorite snack?
I am an animal named after the animal that I eat, what am I?
If you have me you want to share me, if you share me you won’t have me. What am I?
You walk into a room with a rabbit eating a carrot, a pig eating slop and a monkey eating a banana. Which is the smartest animal in the room?
I come from a mine and get surrounded by wood.  Everyone uses me, what am I?
Mr. Red lives in the red house. Mr. Blue lives in the blue house. Mrs. Pink lives in the pink house? Who lives in the white house?
If two is company and three is a crowd, what is 4 and 5?
I am clean when i’m black and dirty when i’m white. What am I?
I am neither a guest or a trespasser be, to this place I belong, it belongs also to me.
I’m tall when I’m young and short when I’m old. What am I?
I start with M, end with X, and have a never ending amount of letters. What am I?
I once was full of thoughts but now I am white and empty. What am I?
Only one color, but not one size, Stuck at the bottom, yet easily flies. Present in sun, but not in rain, Doing no harm, and feeling no pain. What is it?
I always run but never walk, I sometimes sing but cannot talk, No head on which a hat to place, You always look me in the face. What am I?
Take off my skin and I won’t cry, but you will, what am I?
What begins when things end and ends all things that begin?
What has 88 keys but can’t open a single door?
I am always in front of you and never behind you.  What am I?
How many species of animals did Moses take on the Ark with him?
answer: None, Noah was on the Ark, not Moses

riddle: I am a kind who is good at measuring things.  What am I?

You just bought a cute rabbit at a pet store.  The rabbit can breed once every month, and deliver 7 babies at a time.  How many rabbits do you have after 12 months?
answer: One, it takes two rabbits to breed.

riddle: Tom’s height is six feet, he is an assistant at a butcher’s shop, and wears size 12 shoes. What does he weigh?

answer: The turkey because it is always stuffed

riddle: What did the baseball glove say to the baseball?

What starts with an e but only has a single letter in it?
Slayer of regrets, old and new, sought by many, found by few. What am I?
Five add six is eleven, but six add seven is one. How is that possible?
answer: When you are looking at a clock

riddle: What is the softest nut in the entire world?

answer: Because she likes to rock and roll

riddle: Why did I go golfing with two pairs of pants on?
answer: Just in case I get a hole in 1.

riddle: What does a cat have that other animals do not have?

I always run but never walk, I sometimes sing but cannot talk, No head on which a hat to place, You always look me in the face.  What am I?
A rooster lays an egg on the roof of a barn. Which way does the egg roll?
answer: I doesn’t, roosters don’t lay eggs.

riddle: What does almost no one what, yet almost no one wants to lose?

A man is sitting in his cabin in Colorado. Three hours later he gets out of his cabin in Texas. How is this possible?
answer: The man is a pilot and the cabin is the cockpit of a plane.

riddle: Which kind of nuts are the softest nuts?

What is the safest room to be in during a zombie apocalypse?

What does a snowman eat for breakfast?

Those who have it least don’t know that they have it. Those who have it most wish they had less of it, but not too little or none at all. What is it?
Spelled forwards I’m what you do everyday, spelled backwards I’m something you hate.  What am I?

answer: Because it is worth $100 which is more than a newer $1 bill.

riddle: If you have a bee in your hand, what do you have in your eye?
answer: Beauty, because beauty is in the eye of the bee-holder!

riddle: When you do not know what I am, then I am something. When you know what I am, then I am nothing. What am I?

A man goes to buy a used car. He finds a nice Corvette for $8700 and he buys it without paying a dime. How is that possible?
answer: He didn’t pay a dime, he paid $8,700.

riddle: After you go through a fall I will take over. All life will stall, or at least grow slower. What am I?

What is it that even the most careful person always overlooks?
A pizza weighs ten pounds plus half its own weight. How much does the pizza weigh?
answer: 20 pounds.  10 pounds plus half of 20 pounds equals 20 pounds.

riddle: Two people both eat exactly half of a chocolate bar and nothing else, but one person eats more than the other. How is that possible?
answer: They each eat half of their own chocolate bar, one chocolate bar is bigger than the other.

riddle: If you throw me out of a window,  you’ll leave a grieving wife.  If you leave me in the middle of the door,  you might just save a life.  What am I?
How many bricks does it take to complete a 2,000 square foot building made entirely of brick?
answer: Only one, the last brick completes the building.

riddle: What begins but has no end and is the ending of all that begins?
When is 1600 plus 25 and 1700 minus 35 the same thing?
answer: When you are using military time.

riddle: I am not a holiday. I belong in the month of December, but not in any other month. What am I?

Two in a corner, one in a room, zero in a house, but one in a shelter. What am I?

answer: He is only shot, not dead.

riddle: What do you give to others but still try and keep?

answer: What is the name of the child.  This one is tricky, it did not ask a question.

answer: Jack and Jill were fish, their bowl fell and broke.

answer: Because it’s a giant gas planet.

answer: A quarter and a nickel.  One of the coins is not a nickel but the other one is.

answer: The police never told him where the crime scene was.

answer: First you look in the mirror and see what you saw. You take the saw and cut the table in half. Two halves equal a hole. So you crawl out the hole and now your free.

riddle: How many birthdays does the average women have?
answer: One birthday, the rest are just birthday celebrations or parties.

riddle: There are two fathers and two sons. They walk into a candy store and each buys a candy bar for 50 cents.  The total for all of the candy bars was $1.50. How is that posibble?

answer: You don’t knock on the door of your own room.
